name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Vaccines work.  As Vermont closes in on 80% of our 12+ population vaccinated, there are just 3 people hospitalized in the entire state with COVID-19. Yesterday, we reported just 2 new cases, and thankfully, we have not reported a death from COVID-19 in two weeks.  Vaccines work.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: The latest numbers are in: Another 1,891 Vermonters were vaccinated yesterday, bringing us to 77.2% of the eligible population.    We need 15,359 more to reach our goal of 80%, meaning we’ll drop the remaining COVID-19 restrictions. Sign up at  https://t.co/KaYvmsLE56. #OurShotVT  https://t.co/eP42F1Tl78

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: As discussed at today’s COVID briefing, we’ve adjusted  vaccination numbers to remove some duplication that arose when reporting to the CDC. The good news is, we’re still making great progress towards our goal of 80% of 12+ w/ 76.9% receiving 1 dose.  https://t.co/IfZuYujv28

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: It was great to join my fellow New England governors and Eastern Canadian premiers today to discuss how we can continue our collaboration as we recover from COVID-19. I look forward to working with them to strengthen our economies, revitalize tourism, and combat climate change.  https://t.co/AxMZka6ujW

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: The vaccines work. As Vermont continues to lead the nation in vaccinations, for the first time in over six months, there are fewer than 10 people in the state hospitalized with COVID-19.   Getting vaccinated has never been easier. Find walk-ins today at  https://t.co/KaYvmsLE56

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Vaccines work. The new masking guidance from the CDC is incredibly encouraging. We are reviewing it and Vermont will follow suit. We will discuss our updates at tomorrow’s 11:00 a.m. COVID-19 response media briefing. #OurShotVT

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: In partnership with @VTchamber and @VTEconDev, the State will begin hosting walk-in COVID-19 vaccine clinics for restaurant, hospitality, and tourism workers over the next week.  Learn more:  https://t.co/Zyn388rM0X

mentions.name: vermont agency of commerce & community development

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Parents and caregivers can now make vaccination appointments for children 12-15. The Pfizer vaccine is both safe and effective in protecting children against COVID-19. Sign up or learn more today at  https://t.co/KaYvmsLE56.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: With the FDA‘s approval to expand eligibility for the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine to those 12-15 years old, the country takes another important  step towards defeating this virus and getting back to doing all the things we enjoy. 1/3

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Vermont now ranks first in the nation in both doses administered AND the percentage of our population with at least one dose of life-saving COVID-19 vaccine. Let’s keep up the momentum and keep Vermont’s vaccine rollout #1. Sign up at  https://t.co/KaYvmsLE56  https://t.co/eZA0KhzbmM

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: The science shows us that outdoor transmission of COVID-19 is rare.   The CDC acknowledged this in its updated guidance earlier this week.  So, effective tomorrow, masks are no longer required outdoors in Vermont when physical distancing can be maintained.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Over 60% of Vermonters 16+ have received at least one dose of COVID-19 vaccine. Cases are at a 5-month low and hospitalizations continue to decline.  Vaccines work.   Getting vaccinated is how we'll put this pandemic behind us. Sign up at  https://t.co/KaYvmsLE56 #OurShotVT  https://t.co/d9Mfcjbe86

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Vermont continues to be a national leader on COVID-19 vaccinations.   Keep it up, Vermonters!    https://t.co/v7rn5bc6fl #OurShotVT  https://t.co/Nn6hxFMKLa

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: REMINDER: Today Vermonters age 30 and up are eligible to sign up for their COVID-19 vaccines. Get your appointment today at  https://t.co/1L73BdwK2E

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: The Vermont Forward Plan uses vaccination rates as the key milestones for transitioning Vermont businesses to more general, universal guidance to prevent the spread of COVID-19; modifying travel guidance; and when gathering size can increase between now and July 4.  2/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today the First Lady and I were thrilled to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Vaccinations are how we can put this pandemic behind us. When it’s your turn, make sure you do your part and sign up, not only to protect yourself, but those around you as well. #OurShotVT  https://t.co/xc80Wkio3K

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: REMINDER: As of this morning, Vermonters 50 and older can sign up for their COVID-19 vaccinations. In the first 15 minutes, we’ve scheduled over 10,000 new appointments. If you’re eligible, sign up now at  https://t.co/KaYvmsLE56  https://t.co/4SPdoWwd9n

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Vermont's vaccination strategy has been about prioritizing saving lives. Over 90% of our fatalities from COVID-19 have been among those over the age of 65. With over 83% of the 65+ population with at least one dose (1st in the US), we've seen hospitalizations and deaths decline.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Friday, March 19, marks the one-year anniversary of Vermont’s first confirmed fatalities to COVID-19. In the year since, we’ve lost over 215 of our fellow Vermonters and over 535,000 fellow Americans. 1/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today marks the one-year anniversary of our first confirmed COVID-19 case in Vermont. I was at a Norwich University hockey game when I received the call, and I’m not sure any of us imagined what the year ahead would bring. 1/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: We've just passed an important milestone: 20% of Vermonters over the age of 16 have received at least one dose of a life-saving COVID-19 vaccine. Next week, we begin Phase 5, expanding eligibility to approx.100,000 more Vermonters. #OurShotVT  https://t.co/KaYvmsLE56  https://t.co/ifhzlzSMu9

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: As we’ve said, after this age-band, we’ll next start vaccinating people with certain high-risk conditions because they’re at higher risk if they get COVID-19. 2/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: We're making strong progress through our age bands for COVID-19 vaccines. Starting today, Vermonters 65 and older can sign up to get their shots. If you're eligible, sign up now at  https://t.co/v7rn5bc6fl #OurShotVT  https://t.co/05T0eJKMea

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: With @US_FDA  granting emergency use authorization for the Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccine, we are one step closer to putting this pandemic behind us and building back stronger than before.  https://t.co/kVzz1W2cdN

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: The science and the data also tell us that we can put our kids back in school and still manage the effects of COVID-19. So, the real goal here - and I know it’s one we all share - is to reverse the negative impact of this pandemic on our kids. 12/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Good to hear from @POTUS this afternoon as he addressed the nation's governors at the @NatlGovsAssoc Winter Meeting. The President discussed America's pandemic response, as well as his COVID relief plan and his Administration's infrastructure proposal.  https://t.co/QFZw8hdfcS

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This week, Walgreens received an unanticipated increase in COVID-19 vaccines directly from the CDC. As a result, Vermonters 65 and older can start scheduling vaccine appointments through Walgreens today. You can sign up by visiting  https://t.co/ben4iQdVtE. 1/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Not only are vaccines incredibly effective at preventing COVID-19, they are also showing to significantly decrease transmissibility. As a result, CDC updated quarantine guidance, which has led to changes in Vermont's guidance, as well. 1/8   https://t.co/jBcokUpYn3  https://t.co/XZrLBSyy7f

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today marks 11 months since Vermont’s first fatalities from COVID-19. As we have on the 19th of every month since, I have ordered flags to half-staff to honor their memory and remind us why the sacrifices we’re making are so important. 1/  https://t.co/9AkQCVT3Hr

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Over 60% of Vermonters age 70-74 have already signed up to get their free COVID-19 vaccine. If you have a parent or loved one aged 70 or older, remind them they're eligible to make a COVID-19 vaccine appointment—and, if needed—help them sign up at  https://t.co/KaYvmsLE56.  https://t.co/jNcbehJFFz

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Tomorrow, Feb. 19th, marks 11 months since Vermont's first confirmed fatalities from COVID-19. In honor of the memories of the Vermonters we have lost to this terrible disease, I have ordered flags to fly at half-staff from sunrise to sunset.  https://t.co/cGUAJcIz3y

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Since 8:15 AM, almost 19,000 Vermonters in the Phase 3, 70-74 age-band have scheduled their COVID-19 vaccine. That's nearly 60% of the entire eligible population!   There are enough slots for everyone, so if you haven't signed up yet, there is still time. #OurShotVT

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Vermonters 70 and older are now eligible to be vaccinated. We expect to move through this phase quickly and will then open to 65+ and then those with certain health conditions that put them at greater risk if they get COVID-19. Protecting the vulnerable must be our top priority.  https://t.co/07qdflh7IL

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Because the science and data are clear: age puts you at higher risk of death from COVID-19, and I believe we have a moral obligation to preserve the lives of those who have taken care of us for decades. 8/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Over 85% of Vermonters 75 and older have either received a COVID-19 vaccine or have an appointment scheduled in the coming weeks, but slots are still open. If you are eligible but haven't signed up, you can do so today at  https://t.co/1INpfVnS0F or by calling 855-722-7878.  https://t.co/JGMEkJ1bQd

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: As of this morning, over 29,000 Vermonters 75 and older have signed up for their first COVID-19 vaccination. In total, we've already administered over 55,000 doses. This equates to over 44,000 Vermonters who’ve either received a first dose or second dose of the vaccine. 1/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I have tested negative for COVID-19. In accordance with @healthvermont guidance, I will continue to fulfill my duties while in quarantine and will be tested again on Tuesday, January 26.  https://t.co/FdpbpIXqEi

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: With such a limited and unpredictable supply of vaccine coming to us, we’re prioritizing those most likely to die if they contract COVID. The further down the list older Vermonters are, the more lives we’re risking and we believe preserving life must be our top priority. 6/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This morning I also signed into law H.48, giving municipalities greater flexibility for upcoming local elections due to COVID. This means they can mail ballots to all registered voters in place of more traditional town meetings or in-person elections (like we did in November). 3/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today marks 10 months since Vermont’s first deaths from COVID-19. We’ve lost 163 Vermonters to this terrible virus since the start of the pandemic. This is not just a number- these are moms and dads, grandparents, coaches, mentors, neighbors and our fellow Vermonters. 1/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Tomorrow marks 10 months since Vermont's first confirmed fatalities from COVID-19. In honor of the memories of the Vermonters we have lost to this terrible disease, I have ordered flags to fly at half-staff from sunrise to sunset.  https://t.co/D623137hPN

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: While vaccine supply remains limited and shipments from the federal government remain unpredictable, we must focus on protecting those most likely to die if infected with COVID-19. 7/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: We’re taking this approach because it achieves our primary goal of preserving life. As you know, the older one is, the more likely they are to suffer severe illness or die from COVID-19. 2/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: As the data and science show, the older you are, the more vulnerable you are to severe illness and death from COVID-19.   With an limited supply of vaccine, our focus MUST be saving lives. We have a moral obligation to protect those whose lives are threatened most by this virus.  https://t.co/8TqedBFYN7

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: About 92% of our COVID hospitalizations have been those over the age of 60, and over 80% of deaths have been those over 70. With a limited vaccine supply, we must focus on these populations first to reduce the number of deaths and ease the pressure on our healthcare system. 5/5

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: That's why we’re taking an age-based approach in the next phase of vaccine rollout. The data shows the older you are, the more vulnerable you are to severe risks and death from COVID. Saving lives must be our priority. It’s why we’ve sacrificed so much these past 10 months. 3/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Let's also continue to make healthcare more affordable and stabilize a system that’s front & center in the fight against COVID. And it appears Vermonters have spent much less on healthcare in the last year, so I directed @VermontDFR to determine where rebates are appropriate. 35/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Before COVID, we were slowing these trends and leveling the economic playing field by focusing on the fiscal fundamentals. Because I refused to let state spending grow faster than a working Vermonter’s paycheck, we were finally helping families keep more of what they earned. 17/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: As we prioritize the distribution of a very limited supply of vaccines, we’re focused on saving lives. We know from the science that those who are older, and others with serious underlying chronic conditions, are far more vulnerable to serious illness and death from COVID.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: We know from experience, from the data/science, that those who are older and those with underlying chronic conditions are far more vulnerable to serious long term health issues (and even death) from COVID. That’s exactly why our public health strategies are focused on them. 4/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: @NateSilver538 In Vermont, we will be using an age-based strategy. Why? Because we must prioritize saving lives and protecting the most vulnerable. The science on this is clear — age is the number one correlation for severe outcomes from COVID-19.    https://t.co/hB5myEnGpu

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: 2. Schools do not have to include a question about multi-household gatherings on daily health checkers. But we're all responsible for keeping schools safe by following travel/quarantine guidance & staying home when you’re sick or have been in contact w/someone who has COVID. 3/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: As we receive more vaccines, our top priority must be preventing loss of life, which means focusing on those at highest risk of severe outcomes. Age & some preexisting conditions are top correlators for COVID-19 deaths. We will follow the science to protect our most vulnerable.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: As Vermonters begin to receive the first COVID-19 vaccinations, robust testing and tracing programs remain as important as ever. Vermont already tests at among the highest rate in the US, but we're still expanding capacity.   Sign up for a free test ⬇️  https://t.co/5CyDqpKDsV  https://t.co/NS6BrJDMIT

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Thank you Congressman @PeterWelch for joining my team’s press conference today to provide an update on the COVID relief package passed by Congress last night.   Vermonters appreciate your hard work, as well as the efforts of @SenatorLeahy and @SenSanders to get this done.  https://t.co/4bziuwV0Zl

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: First, we’re making a small, short-term modification to our gathering policy. I want to stress: There’s a risk of COVID transmission when people gather, especially indoors without masks. Staying smart and following our guidance is the best way to limit risk. 6/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: On the bright side, high-risk healthcare workers across the state have started receiving the COVID vaccine and vaccinations for staff and seniors in long-term care facilities are about to begin, which is incredibly important and one of my highest concerns. 5/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: As we have on the 19th of every month, tomorrow we'll lower flags to half-staff in honor the 107 Vermonters we’ve lost to COVID. For months, we were fortunate that our number of deaths remained low, but as we’ve seen cases rise, we’ve seen more deaths. 1/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Having convenient access to up-to-date COVID-19 guidance can help you and your family stay safe. To ensure you have the latest information on the pandemic, sign up for text, email, or phone alerts through VT-alerts. Register today by visiting  https://t.co/VvC3pFgMr9.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: My Administration will focus first on protecting the most vulnerable and those at greatest risk, which is why we will begin our rollout by vaccinating nursing home staff and residents, and those treating and interacting with COVID patients throughout our healthcare system.  3/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I join many across Vermont and the country in welcoming news of the first approved vaccine for COVID-19. This is an important milestone and a major step toward defeating a virus that’s having devastating impacts on families and businesses throughout VT and around the globe. 1/  https://t.co/kfXaLUbYae

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: We still have high case counts, more people in hospitals and more deaths. Nationally, we had more COVID deaths yesterday than those we lost on 9/11. And we're about to hit 300,000 deaths since March- more than we lost in WWI, Korea, Vietnam, Iraq and Afghanistan combined. 4/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Yesterday, the FDA advisory panel recommended emergency use approval for Pfizer’s COVID vaccine. It’s expected that the FDA will make that official within the next two days. This is incredible news and a huge step forward in defeating this virus. 1/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today I joined my colleagues @GovLarryHogan, Gov. @AsaHutchinson, @MassGovernor Charlie Baker and @GovChrisSununu to strongly urge Congress to pass a bipartisan agreement on a COVID-19 relief package this month. Families and businesses are in desperate need and it’s time to act.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: If you’re feeling COVID fatigue, the loss of not being able to get together with others or the anxiety and pressure the pandemic has caused, you’re not alone. These are reasonable, normal responses to a very abnormal event. 8/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: On Friday, we recognized the Vermonters lost to COVID-19 and sadly, since then, we’ve lost at least two more lives. Today I want to talk about one of those lives: Mary Pat Brown. 1/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Yesterday, as we marked 8 months since our first deaths from COVID-19, we lost another Vermonter, bringing the total to 62. After months without a single death, we’ve sadly lost four more Vermonters in the last two weeks. 1/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: My statement on the anniversary of the first two COVID-19 deaths in Vermont:  https://t.co/DH16ouvERH

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Thread re today's media briefing: We continue to see a rise in COVID cases in Vermont, up from an average of 25 cases per day last week to 72 cases reported on Wednesday, 109 on Thursday and 84 today, despite our recent steps to slow the spread. 1/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Important thread: Today we reported 72 new COVID-19 cases – the highest daily number since the start of the pandemic and nearly double what was reported yesterday. 1/

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Fellow Vermonters: Whether gathering to celebrate or to protest results of the election, you MUST do it safely. Wear a mask. Keep your distance. Avoid crowding. COVID cases are developing at the fastest rate since March. We can't let our guard down. Be smart/stay safe. –Gov. Phil

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Practices for winter school sports (except wrestling & indoor track) will begin on Nov. 30 with interscholastic games beginning on Jan. 20 in compliance with new & existing guidance. This six-week period will allow us to monitor COVID activity & make adjustments as necessary. 4/8

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today my team gave an update on COVID-19 guidance for winter school sports and ski areas (you can view the full media briefing at  https://t.co/sGI0D8OMVj). 1/8

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: The first few snowfalls in Vermont are always a beautiful sight, but this year it is also an important reminder that in the coming months we will have to spend more time indoors. If we want to continue to suppress COVID-19, we must be extra careful to protect our communities.  https://t.co/q9RqbJpwYw

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: The latest @VermontDFR modeling shows a slight uptick in VT's COVID cases & positivity rate, though hospitalizations remain low. Outbreaks in our region are linked to small gatherings, so it's important that VTers stay smart about their social activities:  https://t.co/wxoQo7PQO5

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Dr. Beth Kirkpatrick announced that @UVMMedCenter & @UVMLarnerMed will take part in an ongoing COVID vaccine trial. A safe, effective vaccine is essential to managing this virus & this is a testament to the leadership/expertise of these VT institutions:  https://t.co/xPcUppKv1J

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Some highlights from today’s COVID media briefing (you can view the full briefing at  https://t.co/sGI0D8OMVj):

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today marks seven months since Vermont's first confirmed fatalities from COVID-19. In honor of the Vermonters we have lost to this terrible virus, in April, I ordered flags to fly at half-staff on the 19th of every month for the rest of 2020.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: .@VSC_edu & @VTLabor are partnering to offer 100+ FREE classes/training to Vermonters whose jobs have been affected by COVID-19. This is a great opportunity to upskill, reskill and boost your resume for the many careers available in Vermont. Learn more at  https://t.co/zL3Lp8G5e9  https://t.co/l0Xlcx6Z7P

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Vermont has been continually recognized for our efforts to slow the spread of COVID-19. This is due to the work of Vermonters to keep each other safe. But cases in our region are rising. We need to remain vigilant so we can keep case counts low.    https://t.co/jR4O6GuXLI

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Even if you’ve never gotten one before, this is the year to get a flu shot! Dr. Levine, Sec. Smith and I got ours this morning. A flu shot helps protect you and your neighbors, and keeps our health care capacity high in the event of a COVID-19 outbreak:  https://t.co/THN0AW9142  https://t.co/9snjCzeWTj

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: It’s an important part of keeping the capacity of our health care system open in order to care for COVID patients if needed, as well as protect our health care workers:  https://t.co/WrMDCcLrlI. 5/7

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: We’ve had a few COVID cases linked to schools in the last month & we’re not out of the woods w/ this virus. But when these situations occurred (as we knew they would), school leaders responded quickly & worked w/ @healthvermont @VTEducation to prevent in-school transmission. 3/9

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This year, it’s especially important to get your flu vaccine so that we can keep our hospital capacity high in the event of an unexpected COVID-19 outbreak. You can find out more information about the vaccine and where to get yours at:  https://t.co/okkS4SsaNk  https://t.co/7wBUkJeBRc

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Our case counts remain low, but COVID-19 cases are still rising around the country. When we were joined by Dr. Fauci he was clear: We can only continue our success if we stay vigilant and keep doing the things we've been doing: ✅ Wear a mask ✅ Avoid crowds ✅ Keep 6 feet apart  https://t.co/aAkeSHKiHJ

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I want Vermonters to know I understand how stressful and troubling this time is, including the news that President Trump and the First Lady have tested positive for COVID-19. My thoughts are with the President, his family and those he may have come in contact with recently. 1/8

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: During the COVID-19 pandemic, I’ve been so impressed by Vermonters’ ingenuity and creativity. @BerlinElementa1 is one of the many schools working tirelessly to adapt in this unprecedented time & provide the safe in-person instruction kids & families need:  https://t.co/39qoUgSSVU

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This week one of our nation’s top experts on infectious diseases applauded the work Vermonters have done to keep their families and neighbors safe during the COVID-19 pandemic, but he could not have been more clear: we need to stay vigilant to stay safe.  https://t.co/QBwN6QYWEe

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I'm seeing some questions about changes to COVID guidance made yesterday, so please note: The capacity limit on restaurants/bars has NOT increased. It remains at 50%, where it's been for weeks. The change now allows seating at the bar counter, which had been prohibited.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This policy allows people from green counties with low rates of COVID to come w/o quarantine while all others must quarantine for 14 days. So while we look forward to welcoming all who follow this policy, if you’re from a red or yellow county, please quarantine or stay home. 7/10

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Yesterday, Dr. Fauci and I discussed Vermonters' success in suppressing COVID-19 and the importance of keeping our guard up as we move into fall/winter. I'm thankful for his leadership and welcome him to Vermont any time. Watch our press conference here:  https://t.co/9Il9mqzJ4n

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Tomorrow at my regularly scheduled COVID-19 press briefing, I will be joined by Dr. Anthony Fauci to discuss the state and the nation's COVID-19 response.   Watch at 11:00 a.m. via:  https://t.co/lhZZdNHBNr

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: On Friday, our new modeling showed that VT has the lowest COVID-19 positivity rate in the country. This is no accident. Vermonters have stayed vigilante and followed @healthvermont guidelines.   If we continue to listen to the data and science, we can get through this together.  https://t.co/LRKL46X0om

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: As we enter flu season, we all need to continue to do our part to stay healthy. In addition to following @healthvermont COVID-19 guidelines, getting your flu shot can keep our communities healthy and safe.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Yesterday at my bi-weekly press conference, we announced a new partnership with Kinney Drugs to add 11 pop-up COVID-19 testing sites around the state of Vermont.   To see all the testing sites in your area, visit:  https://t.co/WRcySRTvwQ

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This Labor Day weekend, help us keep our COVID cases low. Avoid large crowds, keep six feet apart, wear a mask and follow @HealthVermont travel guidelines.  https://t.co/npoP87sWwf

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Vermont has had success in suppressing COVID-19, but we cannot let up. We must stay vigilant so we can continue moving forward and not lose any ground on the progress we’ve made.  (Clip via @ORCAMedia)  https://t.co/HoGE1UTXrm

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Vermonters have worked hard to slow the spread of COVID-19. As our schools begin to reopen, it is more important than ever to stay vigilant.   We can beat COVID-19 if we continue to:  ✅Wear a mask  ✅Physically Distance  ✅ Stay home when sick

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Now it’s up to all of us to keep it that way.  That means physically distancing, masking up in public, washing your hands a lot, staying home when sick and quarantining when you’ve been exposed to someone with COVID or traveled to a red or yellow county. 4/7

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: A successful return to school is up to all of us. We’ve set health/safety protocols to help keep COVID out of schools and to limit the spread... and public health officials have given the green light for in-person learning because of the low prevalence of disease in Vermont. 3/7

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Thank you Airmen Logan Abell and the @VTNationalGuard for your efforts to provide access to COVID-19 testing for Vermonters.   It's the VT way to lend a helping hand. If we continue to work together—and follow @healthvermont guidelines—we can get through this.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: According to our updated COVID-19 data, which you can see at the link below, VT again had the lowest positivity rate in the US. It's up to all of us to maintain this trend.   - Wear a Mask - Physically Distance  - Wash Your Hands  - Stay Home When Sick    https://t.co/eUmpFyWsRo  https://t.co/ncYEuVXVTQ

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Farmers have not stopped working since the pandemic and are providing us with food, but many of their markets were disrupted, creating economic hardship.  These grants are intended to alleviate losses and added expenses due to the impacts of COVID-19.   More ⬇️

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Yesterday I announced $8 million in grant funding to assist Vermonters with overdue utility bills as a result of economic hardship due to the COVID-19 pandemic.  Applications will be accepted through November 30, 2020.  Details ⬇️   https://t.co/1ml5mw08gF  https://t.co/fmfc2MkjtL

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Reminder: Today marks five months since Vermont’s first confirmed fatality from COVID-19. In honor of the Vermonters we have lost to this terrible disease, I have ordered the U.S. and Vermont State flags to fly at half-staff on the 19th of every month for the rest of 2020.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Vermont's response to COVID-19 has been one of the most comprehensive and effective in the country. As of today, we have the lowest number of cases, per capita, in the US.   Vermonters have stepped up and followed the science.   We can't let up. 1/   https://t.co/TarCZm3QaN  https://t.co/Qai18heCHa

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This week my Administration launched a new $12 million grant program to help mitigate operational expenses and losses for child care providers impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic.  Grant applications are open now through August 26.  More on how to apply ⬇️   https://t.co/xoXUf8vDzt  https://t.co/NQ27cJq9Sh

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Beginning tomorrow, public safety, public health, health care and human services employers whose employees worked to help mitigate or respond to COVID-19 may apply for hazard pay grant funds for their employees.  More information:  https://t.co/wAxhFhDVMa

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Reminder: Tomorrow, in order to help protect the gains we've made in our fight against COVID-19, Vermont's statewide mask mandate goes into effect. name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Sadly, I learned today that we’ve lost another Vermonter to COVID-19, for the first time since June 16. It is a sobering reminder that this virus is still among us, and it’s up to all of us to do our part to keep our friends, family and neighbors safe and healthy.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today, to help protect the progress we've made combating COVID-19 and stay one of the healthiest states in the nation, I signed an Order that will require masks to be worn in public spaces, both indoor and outdoor, where physical distancing is not possible. #MaskOnVT 1/  https://t.co/m0bb0kFGLu

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: A PCR test, which is recommended to confirm the antigen result, has been conducted for 52 of the 65 individuals so far.    Of those 52 people, 48 tested negative. Four people tested positive and are considered confirmed COVID-19 cases. 2/3

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Reminder: Today marks four months since Vermont’s first confirmed fatality from COVID-19. In honor of the Vermonters we have lost to this terrible disease, I have ordered the U.S. and Vermont State flags to fly at half-staff on the 19th of every month for the rest of 2020.  https://t.co/4MoZI2p6F3

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Although this is good news, we must remain vigilant. That means following @healthvermont guidelines. It’s up to all of us to keep these trends going.   “Vermont goes 30 days with no COVID-19 deaths”  https://t.co/BmlxcWTp26

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Vermont’s dairy sector has experienced steep declines in milk prices along with market disruption and increased operating costs due to COVID-19. name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: On Monday, I signed into law S.342, An Act Relating to Temporary Workers’ Compensation Amendments Related to COVID-19. name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Yesterday, Commissioner @MSPieciak presented VT's updated COVID-19 modeling and data. Our seven-day test positivity average is just 0.5% -- the lowest in the United States.  To keep it up, we must remain vigilant. That means wearing a mask when you can't be physically distanced.  https://t.co/3RuxO0xKFe

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today I announced $30 million in housing assistance to those affected by COVID-19.   Renters, homeowners and those experiencing homelessness have all been impacted by this virus and need help, which is why we’ve worked with the Leg. to provide this relief.  https://t.co/DLXKlFh8e4

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Vermont has not had a COVID-19-positive patient in the ICU since May 24.   Keeping physically distanced, wearing masks, washing your hands and following other @healthvermont guidelines are easy ways to show your continued commitment to the health and safety of fellow Vermonters.  https://t.co/mMBlXQ03zb

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Vermont’s 7-day positivity rate of COVID-19 tests sits at 1.28% — among the lowest in the nation.   There are also zero COVID-19 patients in ICUs in the entire state of Vermont.   This is good news, but we must remain vigilant and continue following @healthvermont guidelines.  https://t.co/psYIagVj3A

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Our data continues to show Vermont trending in the right direction. In fact, as of today we had the lowest percent-positivity rate in the USA - fewer than 1% of COVID-19 tests were positive this week. We'll continue to take a safe and methodical approach.   https://t.co/nNrkqDHupa

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Reminder: Tomorrow marks three months since Vermont’s first confirmed fatality from COVID-19. In honor of the Vermonters we have lost to this terrible disease, I have ordered the U.S. and Vermont State flags to fly at half-staff on the 19th of every month for the rest of 2020.  https://t.co/7vGmVQocus

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Any Vermonter who wants a COVID-19 test can get a test. It’s free and easy. Here’s a video from our great team at @healthvermont about what you can expect if you get one.   You can learn more and  sign up here:  https://t.co/CzCbBAXtKd  https://t.co/6PXH8JWYSJ

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: At the start of this pandemic, we needed to act fast to protect the health and safety of Vermonters.   Vermonters responded, and as a result, hundreds of lives have been saved. But, COVID-19 also created an economic crisis. We must act with the same sense of urgency to help. 1/6

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: The fact is, hate, ignorance and the inequality we see is a far greater risk to the long term health of our nation than even COVID-19.  9/10

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: That said, for students and teachers alike, it’s going to look a little different in the fall than it did before COVID-19. But we need to work through these issues together, because we know how vital it is for our kids and their development to move forward and reopen. 3/8

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: As many of you have already heard, we’re now considering the situation in Winooski an “outbreak” with a few dozen cases of COVID-19 over the last week. Our epidemiology team has been on top of this situation, using our enhanced tracing and testing to keep this contained. 1/7

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I've signed an Order establishing a Racial Equity Task Force as part of a broader state effort to promote equity. The fact is, hate, ignorance and the inequality we see is a far greater risk to the long term health of our nation than even COVID-19.  https://t.co/h8dFphdy33

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This task force will be charged with looking at the disparities in COVID-19 infection and death rates, so we can figure out how to close that gap.  They’ll also evaluate what supports we have for racially diverse populations and whether it’s enough. 16/20

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I hear what you have to say and I know we not only need to continue to hear it, but also act.  The fact is, hate, ignorance and the inequality we see is a far greater risk to the long term health of our nation than even COVID-19. 13/20

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: As our modeling continues to show a low number of COVID-19 cases in Vermont, and with recommendations from @healthvermont, today we announced it’s safe to turn the economic spigot a bit more. 1/7   https://t.co/L9E0T5O24k

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: As we methodically reopen our economy, Vermont continues to have one of the lowest COVID-19 growth rates in the U.S., and it's still slowing. tweet: Vermont has the lowest COVID-19 growth rate in the country, thanks to the efforts of Vermonters. As we methodically reopen our economy, it’s important we remain vigilant and continue to follow @healthvermont and CDC guidelines.

tweet: Good news: State data and modeling indicates the spread of COVID-19 continues to slow and Vermont now has one of the lowest 3-day and 7-day growth rates in the country. 4/5   https://t.co/on0yEb443B

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Today I established an Economic Mitigation & Recovery Task Force charged with providing assistance & expertise to mitigate the devastating short-term economic impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic, and develop strategies designed to speed long-term business and community recovery. 1/2

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: This is the first weekend since I issued the Stay Home/Stay Safe Order. This, and other mitigation efforts, are all about slowing the spread of COVID-19. name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Vermont's educators are as critical to our COVID-19 response as anyone. I am incredibly proud of the selflessness of these public servants at this time of need. name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: In consultation with @healthvermont, I'm ordering in-person operations at close-contact businesses, meaning those unable to comply with guidelines for social distancing, to close. Other businesses must work to implement CDC & VDH guidance on COVID-19.   https://t.co/d33P0iAC8D

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (2/3) I want every Vermonter to know I understand the economic and emotional toll COVID-19 is having on each of us. People are hurting and businesses are at risk. Let me assure you, we will pull every lever and turn every dial we can to support folks through this time.#vtpoli

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: (1/3) Today, @SBAgov approved my disaster declaration request due to COVID-19.   Vermont businesses can now apply for Economic Injury Disaster Loans, which offer up to $2 million in assistance, providing help to overcome temporary loss of revenue. #vtpoli  https://t.co/MpwMk7nqwB

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: Grocery & food supply workers are critical to our COVID-19 response. To all of you working long & stressful hours, thank you for your hard work. Keeping food & other essentials accessible is critical & your tenacity is appreciated. With your help, we will get through this #vtpoli  https://t.co/sAxdAjJGU2

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: THREAD: As we face unprecedented challenges & experience disruptions due to COVID-19, I’ll be highlighting Vermonters for their hard work & the sacrifices they’re making to help us get through these tough times. We will get through this, but it'll take all of us doing our part.

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I know there are many disruptions our COVID-19 mitigation steps have caused, but each and every decision we've made is based on science, and will save lives. We must take social distancing seriously. We will get through this. And we'll do it, together. (3/3) #vtpoli

name: Governor Phil Scott
tweet: I am also in regular contact with our congressional delegation, @SenatorLeahy, @SenSanders and Rep. @PeterWelch, as well as Vermont legislators, to find ways to help Vermonters whose employment has been impacted by our COVID-19 response. (2/3) #vtpoli

name: Governor Phil Scott

tweet: (1/3) Every single one of us has a role to play confronting COVID-19 and protecting those who are most vulnerable to it – the very ill and elderly. We’re all in this together. We’re going to act together, and we’re going to get through this, together.  https://t.co/pkqxxFO7Dr
